intro: Mycetia membranacea, commonly known as the membranous mycetia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Caesalpiniaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, often accompanied by stipules. Its fruit is a legume, typically containing several seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical environments. Mycetia membranacea is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
